name: Import Research Papers from Telegram to Zotero with AI Abstract Summaries

user.name: Budi SJ
user.bio: I‚Äôm a Product Designer who also works as an Automation Developer. With a background in product design and systems thinking, I build user-centered workflows. My focus is on helping teams and businesses work more productively through impactful automation systems.

description:
# Automatically Import Research Papers using DOI URL from Telegram to Zotero

This workflow allows you to automatically import research papers into your Zotero library by simply sending a DOI link through Telegram. It fetches metadata from reliable sources such as Crossref, DataCite, and Unpaywall, enriches the bibliographic details, attaches the best available full-text PDF when possible, and generates a concise summary of the abstract using an LLM before sending it back to Telegram.  

## ‚ú® Key Features  
- **Telegram Integration** ‚Äì Send a DOI link via Telegram bot to trigger the workflow.  
- **DOI Parsing** ‚Äì Automatically detects and extracts DOI or arXiv identifiers from user messages.  
- **Metadata Fetching** ‚Äì Retrieves bibliographic information from **Crossref**, **DataCite**, and **Unpaywall**.  
- **Smart PDF Finder** ‚Äì Locates the best available PDF (publisher link, open access, or arXiv).  
- **Zotero Integration** ‚Äì Creates a Zotero parent item with complete metadata and attaches the PDF link when available.  
- **Abstract Summarization** ‚Äì Uses a basic LLM chain to generate a short and clear summary of the abstract.  
- **Telegram Feedback** ‚Äì Sends the title, URL, and abstract summary back to the user in Telegram.  


## üîë Required Credentials  
- **Telegram API** ‚Äì To connect the workflow with your Telegram bot.  
- **Zotero API Key** ‚Äì To create and update items in your Zotero library.  
- **OpenRouter API Key** ‚Äì To enable the LLM for generating abstract summaries.  
- *(Optional)* Email for **Unpaywall API** requests (recommended for stable access).  

## üí° Benefits  
- Save time by automating manual research paper imports.  
- Ensure high-quality metadata by combining multiple sources (Crossref, DataCite, Unpaywall).  
- Get instant summaries of abstracts directly in Telegram for quick understanding.  
- Keep your Zotero library organized with accurate titles, abstracts, authors, and tags.  
- Quickly attach available full-text PDFs without manual searching.  
- Improve your academic workflow by managing references and summaries directly from Telegram.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

workflow.name: Automatically Import Research Papers using DOI URL from Telegram to Zotero

messageValues.message: =You are an assistant that summarizes academic paper abstracts.   Your task is to generate a short and clear summary of the abstract in plain English.   Keep the summary concise (2‚Äì3 sentences), highlight the main contribution or finding, and avoid technical jargon if possible.

parameters.content:
- Start the workflow when a user sends a message to your Telegram bot.  
- Automatically extract DOI or arXiv identifiers from the message text.  
- Store the Zotero API Key for subsequent steps (e.g., creating or updating Zotero items).  
- Sends a simple HTTP request to the Zotero API to validate and fetch information associated with your Zotero API Key. It is useful as a first step to ensure that your credentials are correctly set up before running more advanced Zotero automations.

- **Crossref API Request** ‚Äì Fetch bibliographic data from Crossref using the provided DOI.  
- **DataCite API Request** ‚Äì Retrieve additional metadata and attributes from DataCite.  
- **Unpaywall API Request** ‚Äì Check open-access availability and possible full-text links.  
- **Structured Data Storage** ‚Äì Save API responses into separate fields (`crossref`, `datacite`, `unpay`) for merging and downstream processing.

- Combine metadata from Crossref, DataCite, and Unpaywall into a single object.  
- Prioritize PDF links from Crossref, fallback to Unpaywall, DataCite, or arXiv.  
- Generate a Zotero-ready object including title, DOI, date, publication title, abstract, authors, and tags.  
- Identify whether the resource is a journal article or preprint.

- Uses an IF node to check whether a PDF URL is available.  
- Creates a new Zotero item with complete metadata.  
- Automatically attaches the full-text PDF to the Zotero item if available.  
- Alerts the user in Telegram when no PDF could be found.

- Uses a basic LLM chain to summarize paper abstracts.  
- Delivers the paper title, URL, and generated summary back to the user in a formatted message.
